Title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
Cast: Katharine Hepburn, Ralph Richardson, Jason Robards, Dean Stockwell, Jeanne Barr
Plot: Author Eugene O'Neill gives an autobiographical account of his explosive homelife, fused by a drug-addicted mother, a father who wallows in drink after realizing he is no longer a famous ... See full summary » Author Eugene O'Neill gives an autobiographical account of his explosive homelife, fused by a drug-addicted mother, a father who wallows in drink after realizing he is no longer a famous actor and an older brother who is emotionally unstable and a misfit. The family is reflected by the youngest son, who is a sensitive and aspiring writer. Written by Marc Andreu <mandreu@mediapark.es>
Keywords: actor, sailor, claustrophobia, mother son relationship, husband wife relationship
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 5 wins & 4 nominations.
Location: 21 Tier Street, City Island, Bronx, New York City, New York, USA
Actors: Katharine Hepburn, Ralph Richardson, Jason Robards
Description: Directed by Sidney Lumet.  With Katharine Hepburn, Ralph Richardson, Jason Robards, Dean Stockwell. Author Eugene O'Neill gives an autobiographical account of his explosive homelife, fused by a drug-addicted mother, a father who wallows in drink after realizing he is no longer a famous actor and an older brother who is emotionally unstable and a misfit. The family is reflected by the youngest son, who is a sensitive and aspiring writer.
